net.sourceforge.metrics.internal.prevayler.implementation
Class SystemClock

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--net.sourceforge.metrics.internal.prevayler.implementation.SystemClock
All Implemented Interfaces:
AlarmClock, java.io.Serializable
public class SystemClock
extends java.lang.Object
implements AlarmClock

An AlarmClock that uses the local system clock as its current-time source. This class can be extended so that other time sources can be used.

See Also:
currentTimeMillis(), Serialized Form

Constructor Summary
SystemClock()
          A newly created SystemClock starts off paused with time() equal to new Date(Long.MIN_VALUE).

          Returns System.currentTimeMillis().

Method Detail

currentTimeMillis

protected long currentTimeMillis()
Returns System.currentTimeMillis(). Override this method if you want to use a different time source for your system.

time

public java.util.Date time()
Description copied from interface: AlarmClock
Returns the "current" time. The same value will be returned for every call, throughout the execution of a command, ensuring that each command is executed in a single moment in time. Without this, the commands could not be deterministically re-executed during crash-recovery.
Specified by:
time in interface AlarmClock
Following copied from interface: net.sourceforge.metrics.internal.prevayler.AlarmClock
Returns:
A Date greater or equal to the one returned by the last call to this method. If the time is the same as the last call, the SAME Date object is guaranteed to be returned and not a new, equal one.
